names.english: fleeceflower root beverage for generating hair
names.commonEnglish: Fleeceflower Root Beverage for Generating Hair

actions: Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, nourishes the Blood, nourishes Jing and expels Wind from the skin by nourishing the Blood.
With Dang Gui and Hei Zhi Ma, for constipation due to dry Intestines from Blood Deficiency.
Stabilizes the Kidneys, astringes Jing and Body Fluids and tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin.
With Dang Gui and Shu Di Huang, for night sweats due to Yin Deficiency.
Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Blood and Yin, benefits Jing, nourishes Yin and moistens the Lungs.
With Shu Di Huang, for Liver and Kidney Deficiency.
Strengthens Yang, nourishes Yin, astringes Jing, benefits the marrow and tonifies the Kidneys and Liver.
Nourishes the Blood and nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Deficiency.
With Shan Zhu Yu, nourishes Kidney Yin.
With Dang Gui, Bai Shao and Chuan Xiong, for anemia.
Nourishes and fortifies Liver and Kidney Yin, nourishes Jing and Blood and extinguishes Wind.
Nourishes the Blood, astringes Yin, calms Liver Yang and Liver Wind and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and alleviates pain.
With Bai Shao, Shu Di Huang and Chuan Xiong, for Blood Deficiency or Blood Stasis.
With Shu Di Huang, for Heat symptoms due to Yin Deficiency and Devastated Blood.
With Chuan Xiong, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi, expels Wind and alleviates pain.
Releases the Exterior, disperses Cold, expels Wind-Cold-Dampness and guides Qi to the Tai Yang and Du channels.
Nourishes the Blood

symptoms: Abdominal pain with spasms or radiates to back and waist
manifestations.pulse: Weak and slow or Thready, wiry and even or Thready and weak
